alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 7:39AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, The water overtops the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Friday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon by 445 PM CDT.
